function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Residents in buildings with high exterior glazing reporting higher thermal discomfort and health issues","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Occupant discomfort in apartment housing due to thermal conditions and iaq","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of social interaction due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased time spent in the bedroom not sleeping, but engaging in activities like watching movies or using social media, which can be problematic for resident well-being.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exterior city noise pollution in apartment housing as a source of annoyance that prevents restful sleep.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate daylighting and lack of regulation of human circadian clock due to poor environmental design in residential spaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor mental health due to lack of physical activity and social interactions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disrupted sleep during times of crisis , covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate bedroom design impacting sleep quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in apartment design may not effectively mitigate the spread of contagious diseases, leading to increased transmission risk.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate circadian regulation due to poor design of bedrooms, leading to negative impacts on sleep quality and overall health.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear optimal light levels for each room can lead to dissatisfaction with lighting conditions, impacting resident well-being.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate research on flexible apartment design systems may lead to unsatisfactory living spaces in postcovid-19 housing.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor thermal conditions and iaq greatly affect occupant health and productivity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy within the home","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of standardized metrics for daylighting levels in apartment housing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of green landscapes and open spaces in apartment housing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased urban densification and obstructed views","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in privacy and individual space due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of natural window views and nature experiences in housing design","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited access to outdoor views during a pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relying on directed attention within the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited published research on covid-19 and housing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in terminology and categorization of housing types","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cultural and contextual differences in study locations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of public health regulations","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor building design for health","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban densification leading to concentration of apartment housing in urban centers","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of restorative environmental design in apartment
